name: Mango Chicken Curry
history: Mango Chicken Curry is a fusion dish that blends traditional Indian curry spices with the sweet flavor of mangoes. It's a modern twist on classic Indian cuisine, showcasing the versatility of mangoes in savory dishes.
description: Mango Chicken Curry is a delightful combination of juicy chicken pieces simmered in a rich, aromatic sauce made from ripe mangoes, coconut milk, and a blend of spices. The dish is both sweet and spicy, offering a unique taste experience.

instructions.title: SautÃ© Onions and Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add onions and ginger-garlic paste, cooking until onions are translucent. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and red chili powder.

instructions.title: Cook the Chicken
instructions.description: Add chicken pieces to the pan. Cook until they start to brown.

instructions.title: Add Mango Puree and Coconut Milk
instructions.description: Mix in the mango puree and coconut milk. Season with salt. Bring to a simmer and cook until the chicken is tender.

instructions.title: Finish with Garam Masala
instructions.description: Stir in garam masala and cook for a few more minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with rice or Indian bread like naan or roti.

tips: Use ripe, sweet mangoes for the best flavor in the curry.
Adjust the amount of red chili powder to balance the sweetness of the mangoes.
variations: Add vegetables like bell peppers or carrots for extra nutrition.
Substitute coconut milk with yogurt for a tangier flavor.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a decorative bowl, garnished with a slice of fresh mango.
Pair with a cool, minty yogurt-based side dish.
